context_evidences: - “Keeping people in their homes and out of congregate settings — like shelters — is a key step in helping to stop the spread of COVID-19,” the CDC said. Reference: https://www.healio.com/news/infectious-disease/20210201/cdc-mandates-masks-on-public-transit-extends-eviction-moratorium-to-slow-covid19 published on 2021-02-01 00:00:00

- Although the Supreme Court declined to intervene, four justices dissented, and Justice Brett Kavanaugh wrote a concurring statement saying Friedrich was right that the CDC 'exceeded its existing statutory authority by issuing a nationwide eviction moratorium.' Kavanaugh was not yet prepared to enforce the rule of law, but he warned that he might change his mind if the CDC extended the moratorium again, which the CDC has said it does not plan to do. Reference: https://reason.com/2021/07/08/if-the-cdc-can-impose-a-nationwide-eviction-moratorium-why-cant-it-impose-a-nationwide-vaccine-mandate/ published on 2021-07-08 18:50:55

- Friday's order helps underscore the importance the new administration is placing on masks as part of that effort. Under President Donald Trump, the CDC was blocked from requiring masks on public transportation, but on his first full day in office President Biden signed an executive order requiring passengers to wear face coverings during interstate travel. Reference: https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/01/30/962390180/cdc-issues-sweeping-new-mask-mandate-for-u-s-travelers-extends-eviction-moratori published on 2021-01-30 09:45:49

- The new order arrives at a pivotal moment in the pandemic. One year to the day since the World Health Organization declared the coronavirus a global health emergency, the U.S. has seen nearly 26 million cases and more than 436,000 deaths. And while two vaccines have already begun rolling out, troubling new variants from South Africa and the United Kingdom are raising growing alarm about whether health officials can prevent the virus from spiraling even further out of control. Reference: https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/01/30/962390180/cdc-issues-sweeping-new-mask-mandate-for-u-s-travelers-extends-eviction-moratori published on 2021-01-30 09:45:49

- To help slow the spread of COVID-19, the CDC has mandated that face masks be worn on all forms of public transportation and extended a moratorium on evictions to prevent homelessness and unnecessary congregate living. Reference: https://www.healio.com/news/infectious-disease/20210201/cdc-mandates-masks-on-public-transit-extends-eviction-moratorium-to-slow-covid19 published on 2021-02-01 00:00:00

- The Public Health Service Act goes on to authorize quarantine of disease carriers and 'examination of persons reasonably believed to be infected.' Under the CDC's interpretation, those paragraphs, like the earlier list of disease control measures, are gratuitous and inconsequential. If the CDC is right, Congress might as well have stopped after the first sentence of this section, which authorizes regulations to prevent the interstate spread of contagious diseases. But the fact that Congress did not stop there suggests it did not mean to give the CDC the broad power the agency is claiming. Reference: https://reason.com/2021/07/08/if-the-cdc-can-impose-a-nationwide-eviction-moratorium-why-cant-it-impose-a-nationwide-vaccine-mandate/ published on 2021-07-08 18:50:55
correction_response:
This tweet is somewhat misinformed. While the CDC has previously extended the eviction moratorium as a measure to control the spread of COVID-19, recent legal interpretations suggest that the CDC may have exceeded its authority in doing so. Justice Brett Kavanaugh, for instance, warned that he might change his mind about the legality of the CDC's actions if the moratorium were extended again. The CDC has stated that it does not plan to extend the moratorium further. Therefore, it's not a matter of the CDC choosing not to extend the moratorium, but rather a question of legal authority. 
References: 
https://reason.com/2021/07/08/if-the-cdc-can-impose-a-nationwide-eviction-moratorium-why-cant-it-impose-a-nationwide-vaccine-mandate/
https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/01/30/962390180/cdc-issues-sweeping-new-mask-mandate-for-u-s-travelers-extends-eviction-moratori
https://www.healio.com/news/infectious-disease/20210201/cdc-mandates-masks-on-public-transit-extends-eviction-moratorium-to-slow-covid19
note_1_text: While the Supreme Court did allow the CDC’s moratorium to remain in place until it expired on July 31, Justice Brett Kavanaugh wrote one his concurrence that any future extension of the program would have to be approved by Congress    https://www.npr.org/2021/06/29/1003268497/the-supreme-court-leaves-the-cdcs-moratorium-on-evictions-in-place
note_2_text: The sources in the 1st review were detailed & linked to further information. SCOTUS said no more extensions, CDC was improper agency to rule & congress must create new legislation.  So few days before Aug recess - nothing happened. There's $ to but paperwork is tedious. Wait.
queries:
1. Does the CDC have the power to extend the eviction moratorium?
2. CDC's stance on extending eviction moratorium during delta variant surge.
3. Relationship between CDC's mask mandate and eviction moratorium extension.

Reference: https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/01/30/962390180/cdc-issues-sweeping-new-mask-mandate-for-u-s-travelers-extends-eviction-moratori published on 2021-01-30 09:45:49

- According to the CDC, the extension will carry the order that was scheduled to expire on Jan. 31 through March 31. Reference: https://www.healio.com/news/infectious-disease/20210201/cdc-mandates-masks-on-public-transit-extends-eviction-moratorium-to-slow-covid19 published on 2021-02-01 00:00:00

- In an additional effort to help slow the spread of COVID-19, Walensky signed an extension to the eviction moratorium order, which states that the evictions of tenants could be “detrimental to public health control measures,” and halted all residential evictions. Reference: https://www.healio.com/news/infectious-disease/20210201/cdc-mandates-masks-on-public-transit-extends-eviction-moratorium-to-slow-covid19 published on 2021-02-01 00:00:00

- The Biden administration maintains that the CDC has virtually unlimited authority to control communicable diseases, while the president himself seems to think that authority somehow does not extend to mandating face masks or vaccination. Reference: https://reason.com/2021/07/08/if-the-cdc-can-impose-a-nationwide-eviction-moratorium-why-cant-it-impose-a-nationwide-vaccine-mandate/ published on 2021-07-08 18:50:55

- Justice Brett Kavanaugh wrote a concurring statement saying Friedrich was right that the CDC 'exceeded its existing statutory authority by issuing a nationwide eviction moratorium.' Kavanaugh was not yet prepared to enforce the rule of law, but he warned that he might change his mind if the CDC extended the moratorium again, which the CDC has said it does not plan to do. Reference: https://reason.com/2021/07/08/if-the-cdc-can-impose-a-nationwide-eviction-moratorium-why-cant-it-impose-a-nationwide-vaccine-mandate/ published on 2021-07-08 18:50:55

- Separately on Friday, the CDC announced that it would formally extend a federal moratorium on evictions through March 31. The moratorium, which was designed to help residents who have been economically battered by the pandemic, had been scheduled to expire on Sunday, but was ordered to be renewed by Biden as one of his first acts in office. Reference: https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/01/30/962390180/cdc-issues-sweeping-new-mask-mandate-for-u-s-travelers-extends-eviction-moratori published on 2021-01-30 09:45:49
tweet_text: The CDC has the power to extend the eviction moratorium. As they double down on masks, why wouldn't they extend the moratorium in light of delta variant?
